page.title: 05FARMING - SHEEP
page.content: In April, when the sheep are ready to lamb, the farmer brings them into fields near the farm so that he can check them regulary. As the lambs are born the farmer ensures that the mother has sifficient milk for them.He assists at the birth when necessary. The sheep and lambs are marked and taken back on the fell. Every year the sheep are dipped in order to keep them free from disease.In early summer the sheep have their wool clipped off. The fleece is rolled up and placed in a large sack prior to being taken to the woollen mills. From September onwards the lambs are taken to market to be sold to the butchers.Some lambs are sent away to other farms to be fattened.The tups are put with the ewes in October and November.From time to time the sheep have to be dosed.
